They did more copper alloy tsuba than most Shoami groups (although at least as many were made in Shonai), but also made plenty of iron guards.  I haven't made a study of it, but I think that iron Iyo Shoami would outnumber the soft metal ones.

I still have one iron Iyo Shoami guard signed Matsuyama ju Shoami Morikuni dated Kyoho 7, 2nd month 10th day. 

Jim



  Wasn't Iyo primarily non-iron?  My first thought was Iyo also but I 
  thought this was iron and hence probably not Iyo.
